attributes.action: Re-Structure Doctors Appointment Booking Systems so that Members of the Public can make an Appointment
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have tried on at least 3 occasions this week (19th-25th February 2007) to book an appointment for my son who is complaining of head pains. This being a potentially serious issue, needs to be sorted urgently but I am unable to book an appointment. I would like the prime minister to respond directly to me in the first instance and additionally, the rest of the citizens of England on this issue and explain the exact reasons why this incredulous situation is allowed to continue. Has he lost the ability and direction as an elected person to carry out the will of those that elected him. I'm glad that I am at least not responsible for his or his party's election and never will be.
Please do your job or give the reigns to someone with the will to change this.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Appointments/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
